bit_field_value.name: CS_V_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Chip-select is invalid.

bit_field_value.name: CS_V_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Chip-select is valid.

bit_field_value.name: CS_WP_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Write accesses are allowed.

bit_field_value.name: CS_WP_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Write accesses are not allowed. Attempting to write to the range of addresses for which the WP bit is set results in a bus error termination of the internal cycle and no external cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BAM_0b0000000000000000
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding address bit in CSAR is used in the chip-select decode.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BAM_0b0000000000000001
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding address bit in CSAR is a don't care in the chip-select decode.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTW_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst writes. For example, a 32-bit write to an 8-bit port takes four byte writes.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTW_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Enables burst write of data larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit writes to 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit writes to 8-bit ports, and line writes to 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTR_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst reads. For example, a 32-bit read from an 8-bit port is broken into four 8-bit reads.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTR_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Enables data burst reads larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit reads from 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit reads from 8-bit ports, and line reads from 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BEM_0b0
bit_field_value.description: FB_BE is asserted for data write only.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BEM_0b1
bit_field_value.description: FB_BE is asserted for data read and write accesses.

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b00
bit_field_value.description: 32-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:0].

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b01
bit_field_value.description: 8-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:24] when BLS is 0b, or FB_D[7:0] when BLS is 1b.

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b1x
bit_field_value.description: 16-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:16] when BLS is 0b, or FB_D[15:0] when BLS is 1b.

bit_field_value.name: CS_AA_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. No internal transfer acknowledge is asserted and the cycle is terminated externally.

bit_field_value.name: CS_AA_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Internal transfer acknowledge is asserted as specified by WS.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BLS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Not shifted. Data is left-aligned on FB_AD.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BLS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Shifted. Data is right-aligned on FB_AD.

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b00
bit_field_value.description: 1 cycle (default for all but FB_CS0 )

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b01
bit_field_value.description: 2 cycles

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b10
bit_field_value.description: 3 cycles

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b11
bit_field_value.description: 4 cycles (default for FB_CS0 )

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b00
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 1 cycle. When AA is 0b, 0 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b01
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 2 cycles. When AA is 0b, 1 cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b10
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 3 cycles. When AA is 0b, 2 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b11
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 4 cycles. When AA is 0b, 3 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b00
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the first rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for all but FB_CS0 ).

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b01
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the second rising clock edge after the address is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the third rising clock edge after the address is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the fourth rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for FB_CS0 ).

bit_field.name: EXTS
bit_field.description: Extended Transfer Start/Extended Address Latch Enable Controls how long FB_TS /FB_ALE is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_EXTS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE asserts for one bus clock cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_EXTS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE remains asserted until the first positive clock edge after FB_CSn asserts.

bit_field_value.name: CS_SWSEN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. A number of wait states (specified by WS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for all transfers.

bit_field_value.name: CS_SWSEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. A number of wait states (specified by SWS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for burst transfer secondary terminations.

bit_field_value.name: CS_V_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Chip-select is invalid.

bit_field_value.name: CS_V_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Chip-select is valid.

bit_field_value.name: CS_WP_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Write accesses are allowed.

bit_field_value.name: CS_WP_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Write accesses are not allowed. Attempting to write to the range of addresses for which the WP bit is set results in a bus error termination of the internal cycle and no external cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BAM_0b0000000000000000
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding address bit in CSAR is used in the chip-select decode.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BAM_0b0000000000000001
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding address bit in CSAR is a don't care in the chip-select decode.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTW_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst writes. For example, a 32-bit write to an 8-bit port takes four byte writes.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTW_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Enables burst write of data larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit writes to 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit writes to 8-bit ports, and line writes to 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTR_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst reads. For example, a 32-bit read from an 8-bit port is broken into four 8-bit reads.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTR_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Enables data burst reads larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit reads from 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit reads from 8-bit ports, and line reads from 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BEM_0b0
bit_field_value.description: FB_BE is asserted for data write only.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BEM_0b1
bit_field_value.description: FB_BE is asserted for data read and write accesses.

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b00
bit_field_value.description: 32-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:0].

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b01
bit_field_value.description: 8-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:24] when BLS is 0b, or FB_D[7:0] when BLS is 1b.

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b1x
bit_field_value.description: 16-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:16] when BLS is 0b, or FB_D[15:0] when BLS is 1b.

bit_field_value.name: CS_AA_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Internal transfer acknowledge is asserted as specified by WS.

bit_field_value.description: 2 cycles

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b01

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b01
bit_field_value.description: 2 cycles

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b10
bit_field_value.description: 3 cycles

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b11
bit_field_value.description: 4 cycles (default for FB_CS0 )

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b00
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 1 cycle. When AA is 0b, 0 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b01
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 2 cycles. When AA is 0b, 1 cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b10
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 3 cycles. When AA is 0b, 2 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b11
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 4 cycles. When AA is 0b, 3 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b00
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the first rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for all but FB_CS0 ).

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b01
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the second rising clock edge after the address is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the third rising clock edge after the address is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the fourth rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for FB_CS0 ).

bit_field.name: EXTS
bit_field.description: Extended Transfer Start/Extended Address Latch Enable Controls how long FB_TS /FB_ALE is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_EXTS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE asserts for one bus clock cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_EXTS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE remains asserted until the first positive clock edge after FB_CSn asserts.

bit_field_value.name: CS_SWSEN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. A number of wait states (specified by WS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for all transfers.

bit_field_value.name: CS_SWSEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. A number of wait states (specified by SWS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for burst transfer secondary terminations.

bit_field_value.name: CS_V_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Chip-select is invalid.

bit_field_value.name: CS_V_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Chip-select is valid.

bit_field_value.name: CS_WP_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Write accesses are allowed.

bit_field_value.name: CS_WP_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Write accesses are not allowed. Attempting to write to the range of addresses for which the WP bit is set results in a bus error termination of the internal cycle and no external cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BAM_0b0000000000000000
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding address bit in CSAR is used in the chip-select decode.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BAM_0b0000000000000001
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding address bit in CSAR is a don't care in the chip-select decode.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTW_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst writes. For example, a 32-bit write to an 8-bit port takes four byte writes.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTW_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Enables burst write of data larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit writes to 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit writes to 8-bit ports, and line writes to 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTR_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst reads. For example, a 32-bit read from an 8-bit port is broken into four 8-bit reads.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BSTR_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Enables data burst reads larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit reads from 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit reads from 8-bit ports, and line reads from 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BEM_0b0
bit_field_value.description: FB_BE is asserted for data write only.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BEM_0b1
bit_field_value.description: FB_BE is asserted for data read and write accesses.

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b00
bit_field_value.description: 32-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:0].

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b01
bit_field_value.description: 8-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:24] when BLS is 0b, or FB_D[7:0] when BLS is 1b.

bit_field_value.name: CS_PS_0b1x
bit_field_value.description: 16-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:16] when BLS is 0b, or FB_D[15:0] when BLS is 1b.

bit_field_value.name: CS_AA_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. No internal transfer acknowledge is asserted and the cycle is terminated externally.

bit_field_value.name: CS_AA_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. Internal transfer acknowledge is asserted as specified by WS.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BLS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Not shifted. Data is left-aligned on FB_AD.

bit_field_value.name: CS_BLS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Shifted. Data is right-aligned on FB_AD.

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b00
bit_field_value.description: 1 cycle (default for all but FB_CS0 )

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b01
bit_field_value.description: 2 cycles

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b10
bit_field_value.description: 3 cycles

bit_field_value.name: CS_WRAH_0b11
bit_field_value.description: 4 cycles (default for FB_CS0 )

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b00
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 1 cycle. When AA is 0b, 0 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b01
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 2 cycles. When AA is 0b, 1 cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b10
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 3 cycles. When AA is 0b, 2 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_RDAH_0b11
bit_field_value.description: When AA is 1b, 4 cycles. When AA is 0b, 3 cycles.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b00
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the first rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for all but FB_CS0 ).

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b01
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the second rising clock edge after the address is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the third rising clock edge after the address is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_ASET_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Assert FB_CSn on the fourth rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for FB_CS0 ).

bit_field.name: EXTS
bit_field.description: Extended Transfer Start/Extended Address Latch Enable Controls how long FB_TS /FB_ALE is asserted.

bit_field_value.name: CS_EXTS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE asserts for one bus clock cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CS_EXTS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE remains asserted until the first positive clock edge after FB_CSn asserts.

bit_field_value.name: CS_SWSEN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disabled. A number of wait states (specified by WS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for all transfers.

bit_field_value.name: CS_SWSEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enabled. A number of wait states (specified by SWS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for burst transfer secondary terminations.

register.name: CSPMCR
register.description: Chip Select port Multiplexing Control Register

bit_field_value.name: CSPMCR_GROUP5_0b0001
bit_field_value.description: FB_CS3 . You must also write 1b to CSCR[AA].

bit_field_value.name: CSPMCR_GROUP5_0b0010
bit_field_value.description: FB_BE_7_0 . You must also write 1b to CSCR[AA].
